Package org.bluezoo.gumdrop.smtp

Enum BodyType

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Enum<BodyType>
      • org.bluezoo.gumdrop.smtp.BodyType
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<BodyType>
    public enum BodyType
extends java.lang.Enum<BodyType>
    SMTP message body type as declared via the BODY parameter.

    The BODY parameter is specified in the MAIL FROM command and indicates the type of content encoding used in the message body:

    • SEVEN_BIT - Traditional 7-bit ASCII content (default)
    • EIGHT_BIT_MIME - 8-bit MIME content (RFC 6152)
    • BINARY_MIME - Raw binary content (RFC 3030)

    Example usage: 

     MAIL FROM:<sender@example.com> BODY=8BITMIME
 MAIL FROM:<sender@example.com> BODY=BINARYMIME

    Important: When BODY=BINARYMIME is specified, the message MUST be transmitted using the BDAT command (CHUNKING extension). The DATA command is not permitted for binary content because dot-stuffing could corrupt binary data.

    Author:
    Chris Burdess
    See Also:
    RFC 6152 - 8BITMIME, RFC 3030 - BINARYMIME

    • Enum Constant Detail

      • SEVEN_BIT

        public static final BodyType SEVEN_BIT
        Traditional 7-bit ASCII content.

        This is the default body type when no BODY parameter is specified. All content must be US-ASCII (characters 0-127), with lines no longer than 998 characters.

      • EIGHT_BIT_MIME

        public static final BodyType EIGHT_BIT_MIME
        8-bit MIME content (RFC 6152).

        Allows octets with values 128-255 in the message body. This is commonly used for messages with non-ASCII text or binary attachments that have been encoded with base64 or quoted-printable.

      • BINARY_MIME

        public static final BodyType BINARY_MIME
        Raw binary content (RFC 3030).

        Allows arbitrary binary content without any encoding. When this body type is declared, the message MUST be transmitted using the BDAT command because the DATA command's dot-stuffing could corrupt binary data.

      • getKeyword

        public java.lang.String getKeyword()
        Returns the SMTP keyword for this body type.
        Returns:

      • requiresBdat

        public boolean requiresBdat()
        Returns true if this body type requires BDAT for transmission.

        Only BINARY_MIME requires BDAT; the other types can use either DATA or BDAT.

        Returns:
        true if BDAT is required
